If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John ‘Lucky’ Linderman, this movie knows that one doesn’t need to weigh the script down with brilliant storytelling (Spaniards dishonor themselves by betraying Don Maquare) if they can deliver on the wild action.
You’ll seldom find a better plane-to-plane aerial stunt

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form an alliance against the monsters. Director Simon Wells uses computer-generated imagery to tell an incredible story about two friends who meet and fall in love one day without either of them realizing it was happening.” There’s nothing but bad news for the young boy, unless you count love — which he doesn’t
